candidates.title: Update Perlin Surflet
candidates.body:
Perlin surflet noise didn't previously have benches. They now do. Also updated the examples to output 2D, 3D and 4D images.

The perlin surflet core functions now take a Vector2/3/4 as it's input,instead of taking an array and converting.

candidates.title: Add spheres to core functions
candidates.body:
Spheres will output a series of concentric spheres, as a triangle graph between 0 and 1, at the specified frequency. It has 2D, 3D and 4D versions.

The cylinders generator was updated to call the spheres functions. It always calls the 2D version, because the 2D version is equivalent to what cylinders is already built to do. Spheres is a generalization of that to higher dimensions.

Also fixed the cylinders example.

candidates.title: Release v0.8.2
candidates.body: MSRV updated from 1.51 to 1.56 to support 2021 Edition

candidates.title: Turn off default-features for rand since they're not used anyway
candidates.body: Brings the number of transitive dependencies down to 9. I've got another branch which upgrades to rand 0.8 (which is technically a breaking change, because of the `impl Distribution<PermutationTable> for Standard` impl), and that reduces it to just 7.

candidates.title: First batch of fixes from Aubrey
Fix example dependencies
candidates.body:
Each example uses NoiseImage::write_to_file, which uses cfg(feature="images"). (note, "images", not "image"). 

Previously, running an example without features would give an error like: `target 'perlin' in package 'noise' requires the features: 'image'`, and running again with feature 'image' would give: `no method named 'write_to_file' found for struct 'NoiseMap' in the current scope`. Running again with feature 'images' works as expected.

candidates.title: Implement Vector math
candidates.body: Internally use Vector2/3/4 instead of arrays, with methods and implementations on the vectors to make the code more concise.

candidates.title: Make library no-std compatible
candidates.body:
Adds `#![no-std]` to the library. Std is only required for the writing images to files, so the use of `std` is tied to the `images` feature.

Closes #251

candidates.title: Implement Simplex Noise (again)
candidates.body:
Re-Implement Simplex Noise, based on Stefan Gustavson's Public Domain code, available here: http://staffwww.itn.liu.se/~stegu/aqsis/aqsis-newnoise/sdnoise1234.c

The big difference from Perlin's simplex code is that this includes the analytic derivatives for the noise as well. The signature is as follows:

```rust
pub fn simplex_3d(
    x: f64,
    y: f64,
    z: f64,
    hasher: &dyn NoiseHasher,
) -> (f64, [f64; 3])
```

If the derivative is not needed, then silently discarding the derivative portion of the returned tuple will optimize out the unused portions of the code.

repo.name: noise-rs
repo.description: Procedural noise generation library for Rust.
